content: Ministry of the Government of Singapore The **Ministry of Manpower** (**MOM**; [Malay](/wiki/Malay_language): *Kementerian Tenaga Manusia*; [Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_language): 新加坡人力部; [Tamil](/wiki/Tamil_language): மனிதவள அமைச்சு) is a [ministry](/wiki/Ministry_(government_department)) of the [Government of Singapore](/wiki/Government_of_Singapore) responsible for the formulation and implementation of policies related to the [workforce](/wiki/Workforce) in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). It was formerly known as the **Ministry of Labour** from 1955 to 1998. ## Organisational structure The Ministry oversees 3 statutory boards, the [Central Provident Fund Board](/wiki/Central_Provident_Fund_Board), the [Singapore Labour Foundation](/wiki/Singapore_Labour_Foundation) and [Workforce Singapore](/wiki/Workforce_Singapore). ### Statutory Boards - [Central Provident Fund Board](/wiki/Central_Provident_Fund_Board) - [Singapore Labour Foundation](/wiki/Singapore_Labour_Foundation) - [Workforce Singapore](/wiki/Workforce_Singapore) ## Ministers The Ministry is led by the **Minister for Manpower**, who is appointed as a member of the [Cabinet of Singapore](/wiki/Cabinet_of_Singapore). At its formation, the portfolio was titled **Minister for Labour** before being renamed to its present designation in 1998. The ministry itself was established following the [1955 election](/wiki/1955_Singaporean_general_election) during [David Marshall](/wiki/David_Marshall_(Singaporean_politician))'s [First Cabinet](/wiki/First_David_Marshall_Cabinet), with [Lim Yew Hock](/wiki/Lim_Yew_Hock) serving as its inaugural minister. Lim retained the portfolio following Marshall's resignation in 1956, continuing to head the Labour Ministry in his own [Cabinet](/wiki/First_Lim_Yew_Hock_Cabinet) after assuming office as the [Chief Minister](/wiki/Chief_Minister_of_Singapore), and remained in the position until the [1959 election](/wiki/1959_Singaporean_general_election). ### Minister for Labour (1955–1998) MinisterTook officeLeft officePartyCabinet**[Lim Yew Hock](/wiki/Lim_Yew_Hock)** MP for [Havelock](/wiki/Havelock_Constituency) (1914–1984)6 April 19553 June 1959[LF](/wiki/Labour_Front) (until 1958)[Marshall](/wiki/First_David_Marshall_Cabinet)[Lim](/wiki/First_Lim_Yew_Hock_Cabinet)[SPA](/wiki/Singapore_People%27s_Alliance) (from 1958)**[K.
